medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Patients presented with symptoms ranging from mild or no pain to moderate pain after various activities including lifting and twisting. Symptoms included popping sensations and intermittent weakness, most notably more severe on the right wrist for some individuals. Duration of symptoms varied, and some reported exacerbation related to specific activities like lifting. Certain cases showed stepwise clinical progression, while others remained asymptomatic.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Medical histories include conditions such as hiatal hernia, transient ischemic attacks, diabetes mellitus, hypertension, pancreatic cancer, hypothyroidism, and carpal tunnel syndrome. Some patients had undergone previous surgeries, such as carpal tunnel release.
medical_history.social_history: Some patients were noted to have occupational exposures, such as the use of impact hammers. No specific details regarding lifestyle factors like smoking or alcohol use were mentioned.
